data.title: GCSE Physics (Single Science) Revision
data.meta_description: Radioactive sources can be very useful but need handling carefully to ensure safety.
data.text:
In some cases, injected radioactive sources (such as technetium-99) can be used as radioactive tracerA radioisotope used to trace, eg the flow of blood through an organ. to make soft tissues, such as blood vessels or the kidneys, show up through medical imaging processes.

An isotope emits gamma rays that easily pass through the body to a detector outside the body, for example a âgamma cameraâ.

In this way, the radioactive isotope can be followed as it flows through a particular organ in the body.

Changes in the amount of gamma emitted from different parts would indicate how well the isotope is flowing, or if there is a blockage.
